citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility did not provide appropriate preventative measures for heartworm disease to a male fox as prescribed by the
attending veterinarian. The fox tested positive for heartworms during a routine annual vet visit on 2/13/24. An internal
review conducted by the facility determined that staff for the facility did not give the monthly oral heartworm preventative
as prescribed by the attending veterinarian over the previous 12 months (missed four consecutive months and a few other
months during that period). While being examined under anesthesia at the vet clinic on 4/10/24 the fox went into shock,
did not respond to resuscitative measures and euthanasia was elected. Many adult heartworms were present in the heart
on necropsy along with secondary lung changes.
Maintaining adequate programs of veterinary care including following the prescription guidance of the attending
veterinarian regarding parasite prevention protocols is necessary to ensure the use of appropriate methods to prevent
diseases such as heartworm disease and protect the health of the animals.
The facility shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care to include the use of appropriate methods
to prevent and control diseases. The facility has established a new computer based program for keeping track of
administration of medications and preventatives including an automated reminder system.
Corrected prior to this inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
